text:
i hope this is the right spot to ask, seems general enough...

i would like to store data in a text field and then have another field that is a url that concatenates specific text with it and creates a link.

for instance, let's say i have a property in HS called "favorite_food" that just says "pickles" -- then i'd like to create another property in HS called "favorite_food_search" that takes the info from favorite_food and adds it to the end of a URL, such as...

<https://www.google.com/search?q=pickles>

is there a way to do this?

i need sending an CRM email with template via API call. please help. Specifically, I’m using PHP for this project. Could someone help me with the best approach or any resources on how to achieve this within HubSpot?

Hello,

We have a custom object that has a file field that allows uploading multiple files.

Since we need to process this information to send it via API to another system outside of HubSpot, we created a custom code that reads the information and since it is a file declared private, we must obtain the signed URL and obtain the binary file to send.

Until now we have not had a problem, however we have a record in which there are several files that have "commas" in their names and when doing the GET and processing there are changes with the handling of upper and lower case when parsing the comma and it does not find the file within HubSpot, returning error 404.

In this video, we explain the situation better: <https://share.vidyard.com/watch/zG8ip9CLvsztngQPz53gUv>

Any solution that we can apply? We have already tried to apply the urlencode but without success.
Hi all, I requested access to UI extensions but haven't been approved yet. How long does it usually take approval?

Hello. Looking for a bit of guidance on our process here.
We're a fairly small partner agency and we're creating websites using the Content Hub builder and various marketplace themes (mostly CLEAN and Sprocket Rocket). The problem that we're running into is that we're starting from scratch on each website and repeating a lot of the same work. Is there a recommended way for us to create a few site templates (maybe in our demo portal) then just upload them to client portals and finish them out there? I feel like we could be saving ourselves a ton of time and effort, but we're not web-devs by trade so this isn't something we have much experience with. Any advice would be very much appreciated. Thank you!
Hi <@U07TX4SJ7CH> if you're using Sprocket Rocket they have a functionality where any custom modules can be uploaded to their platform. This way they can be reused in other projects.
Also with Sprocket Rocket, you can also add custom css and save it for newer projects. I use the same methodology they use to keep everything as components or modules

I've scoured their documentation and have not been able to find a way to upload things to their app (outside of the Figma integration). It just seems like a drag and drop layout tool. Is there something I'm missing?
btw... thank you for the reply :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm about to enter a meeting, but let me see if I can send you the way to deploy you custom modules to their platform
That would be amazing. Thank you!
getting some 500s from HubSpot APIs this morning
seems to be getting worse by the minute

I have a problem.

• I have a marketing email that I want to send.
• The subject matter of the email is related to both B2C and B2B audiences.
• The content, however, is the same regardless of the recipient.
• We have subscription lists for B2C and B2B.
• HubSpot makes me pick a Subscription Type. So I have to select either my B2B or B2C list.
My understanding of how HubSpot works is that if I set this email to use our B2B subscription type, that it won’t be sent to a contact that is only subscribed to the B2C list.

Is that true? And if so, how do I work around that without duplicating the email and creating a second branch in a workflow responsible for doing the sending? Is it not possible to send a marketing email to someone as long as they are subscribed to any _one list?_

HI I need help urgently!
I need to design this type same design upload file feature in my HubSpot form how could i achieve it? please help me
<@U07PJ1E62V6> Does it have something to do with the "sync user modules" function? I haven't been able to determine if that's doing anything.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!

I created a custom Account object. A Company can have 0 or more Accounts, and an Account must belong to 1 and only 1 Company. I enforce this on the Account creation card. Additionally, a Deal can have 0 or more Accounts and an Account can belong to 0 or more Deals. However, I would like to constrain the Accounts that can be added to a Deal to the Accounts that are associated with the same Company as the Deal. I haven't found a way to do this with the out-of-the-box cards. How should I do this?
is there anyone can fix my issue please i need really urgent
Hey <@U07TX4SJ7CH>, I'm the lead dev at a sprocket rocket. I'm about to head out for the weekend. But feel free to DM me Monday morning. I can help answer any questions. :grinning:

We don't have a system to move assets between portals. Sync user modules allows you to use your modules inside our app Drag and drop builder, but not between portals. But there are others ways to do that
